intro: Viola diffusa var. brevibarbata, commonly known as the short-bearded violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–20 cm, featuring heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces violet-blue flowers with a distinctive short, hairy beard on the lower lip of the petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable species for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
